name: fuckyoufriday
text: I love the one-panel street protest fantasy; it completely makes the strip for me. The slogan on the sign, Beef's furious expression, the somehow perfect inclusion of cold weather hat and scarf... an all-time favorite.

name: petitegitan
text: When you are really bored, you imagine famous people doing things that are exciting.

name: hollis
text: Maybe it's your brain's last-ditch effort to save you from going into a boredom coma.  "Quick, activate vicarious fantasy mode!"

name: soticoto
text:
Kevin Bacon getting in a heated argument with someone using their phone to photograph him touching vibrators in Anne Summers...

... And I am at the Bead Shop.

name: soticoto
text: Of course if the Bead Shop IS Anne Summers then the boredom rating just dropped.

name: honesttom
text: The anal bead shop.

name: iduf
text:
Yes, that was the joke... A YEAR GO.

Now the joke is you, but me also for taking the time to respond to this.

name: iduf
text: Goddamn typos. All making me the joke and what have you.

name: greyfield
text:
Madonna is stealing babies from local orphanages and kindergartens to fill her mansion...

... And I am at the bead shop.

text: Wow. I just imagined a Lord of the Flies type scenario after Madonna returns from a non-stop 5 year tour.

text: I just imagine every romantic rival I've ever had having the most fun possible with every potential partner and then GODAMMIT WHY CAN'T THE LAWN CUT ITSELF I GOT A LIFE TO LIVE!!!

text: A Support Euthanasia for Dudes Who Have Been Brought To The Bead Shop T-Shirt is NECESSARY.

text: This is why I may occasionally go to a bead shop, or take my mother there, but I would never make a dude go in with me.

name: trap

name: girdag
text:
I think it's that guy from Princess Bride, can't remember the name of who he played.

Hold on, Wikipedia will tell me...Wallace Shawn. Who, indeed, did apparently play Freud in The Hotel New Hampshire. Well done.

name: tekende
text: He also had a recurring role in The Cosby Show as the Huxtables' neighbor. There was a pretty good episode where Cliff borrowed his cordless drill (or screwdriver or something) and lost it.

name: puguglypress
text: Oh man that is mega nasty

name: perilon
text:
At the time this strip was posted, it was true; there were zero results for Kazenzakis and it suggested the alternate spelling Kazantzakis, for the famed Greek writer. However, TO THIS DAY (Jan. 5, 2009), a search for Beef's name typed in Greek returns no hits! Whereas searches in English still return, seemingly completely, references to Roast Beef.

So, apparently no Greeks actually have that slightly-different version of the name. However I maintain that it's entirely possible, for the purposes of retconning, that Beef's family just had that spelling changed, for one reason or another, as so many other immigrants did when they came to America.

Solved!

name: mangaknightz
text: hell yes beef speak the truth on boring places

name: untilyouaresonude
text: Moral: Your girlfriend WILL take you places you don't want to go.

name: rykan
text:
I am that girlfriend, and I have taken my man to those places.

I feel ashamed .

name: zapatos
text: Its not so bad, I'm sure you're cool most of the time.  Most of the rest of the time.

name: atticusonline
text: Ok you're in. Now try and get her to take off her clothes. We'll stand back and watch.

YOU are my boring place.

Mike Watt is brilliant.

name: spectre
text: Are they still AROUND? I went to a fIREHOSE concert in 1989 and it was hella Boring Place.

name: varnish
text: Everyone has their boring place. For me it's fabric stores. Row after row of bolts of dusty fabric,  little old ladies with blue hair tottering around between them...

name: tellumo
text: Beef does not dig the yarn store either.

name: nonemorenegative
text: Ahahaha I missed this one... "Sass Foot" gets a hearty lollin' :)

name: slab64
text: Sass foot people can walk at a normal pace, but it looks completely insane.

name: budenhagen
text: oh my god reading that entry then closing it to have the stark white assetbar backround staring at me really did a number on my eyes

name: xiaomimi
text: FUCKIN' TELL ME ABOUT IT

name: layzerblade
text: There should be more examples of Beef straddling the line between being a devoted boyfriend and a complete creepy-creep creep-creep, because it is one of his funniest/most touching traits.

name: tekende
text: Wow. I read this comment and couldn't help hearing Tom Waits saying it, and it's just so perfect.

name: varnish
text: FUCKIN GOD DAMN SON OF A BITCH

name: sargasm
text: Beef is Inside before he even realizes what's going on.  Poor guy.

name: epicurus
text: We have all been to the bead shop. a very, very easy 5/5.

name: djwhiterabbit
text:
we all have our own, private Bead Shops. mine is the sock shop. also occasionally the grocery store.

when visited alone, these places are not a problem. when visited with a ditherer and/or dawdler, these places become personal hells, demanding protests and, ideally, euthanasia.

name: quantumcasaba
text: I have found my Boring Place, and it is called Wow Outlets. It is not 'wow.' It is Wind chimes! Wicker furniture! Dolls each with one eye that won't open! Chipped coffee mugs with three-dimensional poodle heads sticking out of a two dimensional poodle drawing (on the coffee mug)! Gas grills?

name: closefriend
text: The most knife-twisting part of the Boring place is that invariably, the person you're with thinks it's the greatest place in the universe.

name: hellabosque
text: man i love bead shops

name: ibetso
text: yep, me too.

name: heccibiggs
text: When I moved to Nottingham for uni, I saw there was a bead shop (called "The Bead Shop") and immediately thought, oh man hilarious a boing place. Anyway, circumstances dictated that I go in there one day last term, and I ended up despising myself because of how much I enjoyed myself. I don't know what the fuck's wrong with me.

name: cagliostro
text: I have to point out 'boing place', not in the spirit of typo-correcting dickery, but because it really made me laugh. Chubby as a symbol of my goodwill.

name: straw
text: "This is a boring place!" is an alarmed thought-process everyone has had while out and about with their girlfriend or boyfriend.

name: steerpike66
text: Wallace Shawn is the perfect highbrow reference to be nose deep in cleavage giggling.

name: philosophe
text: I wonder if he gets mad tail with that voice of his

name: nbray
text: Women find him devestating. He's just this oversexed, brilliant kind of animal.(double highbrow reference combo! [300 points])

name: natashamarie
text: There are actually whole shops just for beads?

name: connellingus
text: There are, and I have been Beef in this story at a real store called "Beadazzled."

name: cagliostro
text: There's one where I live called 'Beadasaurus'. My friend used to work there at weekends. I don't think it was a very exciting job.

name: gussiejives
text: For me the best part is the steady angering of Beef's expression as he contemplates what could be happening.  Mouth twisting, then brows furrowing....

name: dracer2
text:
I think she was saying that Dean Cain 29 was stupid because he implied that Hitler was a pretty bad pervert instead of the usual murdered/bigot/war monger/history's greatest monster allegations that are levelled at Hitler.

Yes, Hecci Biggs: Hitler Defender.

name: riazm
text: In some boring places the edges of containers can provide a saving grace of interest. Not in the bead shop.

text: Bob Dylan has several ranches, but only the one on Neptune is illegal.

name: em2
text: illegal ghost ranch

name: molesticide
text:
sometimes she takes me to bed bath and beyond.

the universe, however, granted me one small conceit in this matter.

in my town, bed bath and beyond is two store-fronts away from EBgames. they are in the same parking lot.

victory!

name: molesticide
text: A comment left by molesticide was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by phthoggos, the_doz, shounenhero)

text: agreed.

text: My job at the university lab was a boring place.

name: presterjohn
text:
Next time your significant other drags you to a Boring Place, consider telling them "I love you, honey, but I'm not staying here unless I get a paycheck."

Don't dare say it, but, y'know, keep it in mind.

name: phthoggos
text: panels 5-6: Roast Beef is oddly fascinated by how boring this place is.

name: cthulhu235
text: My favorite part about when Google asks, "Did you mean...?" is that when you click on it, it often also returns 0 results.

name: deusoma
text: I have never, ever believed it coming from anyone else, but somehow I can believe that Ray never whacks off. It just, I don't know, fits him somehow.

name: samspud
text: You are right, that was my first thought as well. Also, his condom placement strategy is brilliant

text:
no

i preferred not to know to be perfectly honest

name: i_love_kate
text: I was Okay with not knowing.

name: cagliostro
text: Both Beef's and Cornelius' posts here are fantastic. Especially Cornelius on the Internet as evil oboe.

name: rowboat
text: Here's something I forgot since the first time through: 2005 was the absolute peak of this comic.

name: speccer
text:
This is my absolute favorite comic so far. Beef just can't stand that for even one moment he is in such a boring place, and he is so all-consumed by this fact that he ignores his girlfriend and contemplates suicide.
On a side note, Google is hella rude when it suggests a misspelling of your last name.

name: budenhagen
text: I love this strip so much that I'm actually changing my feelings on it for the first time ever. Pro.

name: ananke
text: This is why I never bring my boyfriend into the bead shop.

name: direhaggis
text: Beef discovers in panel #3 that a Boring place is like the Twilight Zone: suddenly you're inside of it, all is horror and confusion, and you will likely die or greatly suffer in some ironic, terrible way. Maybe he will choke on the free tenth bead while ruminating over Ziggy Stardust and Hedwig Robinson battling the sand minions of Alpha Centauri in a new 'Lost in Space' series on the Sci-Fi channel.

name: edwell
text: I wonder what caused those magenta artifacts in the first couple panels. They're in a couple other strips too.

name: mulisha7
text: This strip perfectly encapsulates all my fears of marriage and long-term commitment.  While I could be ear-deep in some rude titties, instead I am at a bead shop.

name: darleen
text:
One of my fave strips.
I hate it when google suggests a misspelling of my last name. Jerk google.

name: scura
text: the bead shop... the epitome of obscurity, no one, nobody.

name: tekende
text: In Memphis, bixschmix and I actually drove by a bead shop. We briefly considered stopping to take a picture in reference to this strip but did not actually do so for whatever reason.

name: daidai
text:
I can actually identify with this.

Houston, Texas, March 2008.

The day my soul died.

name: zapatos
text: Damn you Beef, remember the toast.

name: jaldor
text: This is probably one of my favorite strips. I had an ex-girlfriend that was really into knitting. We spent a lot of time at the Yarn Barn. I usually ran out of ways to entertain myself in about 30 second (the time it takes for the old woman who runs the place to ask me to stop pressing balls of yarn into my face because I'm mildly autistic and enjoy varying tactile sensations).

name: spicyponyhead
text:
At first, I thought panel one said "head shop". I thought "Roast Beef, why wouldn't you want to go into the head shop with your girlfriend?"

Before I take my boyfriend into the fabric shop, I tell him "THIS IS A BORING PLACE. WE WILL HAVE SEX SOON AFTERWARDS."

name: carlyle
text:
Right now, [famous person] is [verb, ludicrous, raunchy, or otherwise entertaining]

And [I, Me, We, etc.] are at the [Boring Place (suggestions: Bead Shop, Antique Store, Pawn Shop)]

name: lolsworth
text: Do you really get shops that just sell beads? Because what the hell people

name: riotdejaneiro
text:
While The fucking Cure are on tour, Hulk Hogan throws a party at Robert Smiths house, where Danny DeVito smears butter all over the windows while Matt Damon and Ben Affleck play basketball after applying all the make-up from the bathroom. All the while, Christopher Walken tickles a baby until it cries of laughing.
... and I am at the bead shop

name: greenkoolayd
text: i like to make stuff out of hemp chord, so i wouldnt feel entirely out of place at a bead shop.

name: smallberries
text: My girlfriend loves the local head shop, but I don't smoke, don't have tattoos, don't care. I have to interact with the door-knockered nose piercings staff "that's nice filligree work on that hookah ..." and try to tune Phish out. Then again I have dragged various girlfriends to independent record stores over the years, like Murmur in Orlando or Zed's in Long Beach and gleefully thumbed through thousands of LP's until a wild-eyed with boredom girlfriend dragged me from the shop by my ear. The women in my life don't dig record stores for more than 15 minutes.

name: fineoakstructure
text: h...head shop?

name: mtrott
text: You need to find new girlfriends, man.

name: smallberries
text:
Got a '71 Triumph TR6 at a firesale price & brought it home. Excitedly told the (now ex)wife about it- she walked to the bedroom blinds, lifted them a half inch and monotoned, "It's red. When will you mow the lawn?" at which point I learned a valuable life lesson: I'd married the wrong woman.
Upon reflection, trips to the head shop are a walk in the park. Occasional boredom trumps lovelessness.

name: puguglypress
text: What

name: scorpio_nadir
text: Motherfucker, that's cold! Something about that made me jump up and wish there was some pecan pie in the kitchen!

name: samspud
text: an interesting reaction

name: mtrott
text: I used to work in the cosmetics department of Macy's and I could see this inner monologue happening every time some guy got suckered into waiting around while his girlfriend/wife/baby mama was picking out a $25 tube of lipstick. Same thing in Sephora or Bath and Body Works. That look on their face like they would rather be a horse on a truck speeding towards the glue factory.

name: samspud
text: Now that smartphones exist bead shops are less threatening
